metadata.focus: Inclusive WordPress VAPT coverage with populated references
metadata.intended_use: Feed into WordPress Copilot for AI prompt generation and schema creation

wordpress_vapt.title: REST API data exposure
wordpress_vapt.description: Excessive fields or user enumeration via REST leak sensitive data.
tests: Inspect fields returned by public endpoints
assurance: No sensitive fields in public endpoints

wordpress_vapt.title: XML-RPC abuse and exposure
wordpress_vapt.description: Unrestricted XML-RPC enables brute force, pingback DDoS, and unintended actions.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate XML-RPC probes and rate-limit tests

wordpress_vapt.title: Webhook replay protection missing
wordpress_vapt.description: Absent timestamps, signatures, or idempotency keys allow replay attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: admin-ajax misuse without capability checks
wordpress_vapt.description: AJAX actions without nonce/capability checks allow unauthorized state changes.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure SSO callback allowlists
wordpress_vapt.description: Overly broad callback URLs enable token theft or account takeover.

wordpress_vapt.title: Default admin username present
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable usernames increase brute-force success and targeted attacks.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate user inventory and enumeration probes

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak password reset flows
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable or long-lived reset tokens allow account takeover.

wordpress_vapt.title: JWT stored insecurely in localStorage
wordpress_vapt.description: Storing JWTs in localStorage exposes them to XSS attacks.
tests: Check for HttpOnly cookies vs localStorage

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak CAPTCHA implementation
wordpress_vapt.description: CAPTCHA that can be bypassed by bots fails to prevent brute-force attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: Admin endpoints exposed without additional hardening
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable admin endpoints increase targeted brute-force and reconnaissance.

wordpress_vapt.title: Unsafe redirects after login
wordpress_vapt.description: Unvalidated post-login redirects enable phishing and session fixation.

references.name: OWASP Top 10
references.section: A01 Broken Access Control (open redirect impact)

wordpress_vapt.title: CDN/edge misconfiguration leaking private content
wordpress_vapt.description: Improper CDN rules can cache and serve authenticated content publicly.
tests: Probe CDN cache behavior for authenticated pages
Check cache key segmentation by cookies/headers
assurance: No public caching of authenticated content
Cache keys segregate by auth state
remediation: Adjust CDN rules and vary headers

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate CDN cache probes and header audits

wordpress_vapt.title: Cache poisoning via unkeyed parameters
wordpress_vapt.description: Unkeyed query parameters allow attackers to poison shared cache entries.

wordpress_vapt.title: Missing critical security headers
wordpress_vapt.description: Absent CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options, and other headers increase exploitability.
tests: Capture response headers for key routes
remediation: Enable HSTS with preload if appropriate

wordpress_vapt.title: Weak or missing Content Security Policy
wordpress_vapt.description: Absent or permissive CSP increases XSS impact and data exfiltration risk.
assurance: Strict CSP applied to sensitive pages

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate CSP audits and inline script probes

wordpress_vapt.title: Missing Subresource Integrity (SRI) on third-party scripts
wordpress_vapt.description: Without SRI, compromised CDNs or script sources can inject malicious code.
tests: Inspect script tags for integrity attributes
remediation: Add integrity attributes to external scripts

wordpress_vapt.title: Privacy policy and data mapping gaps
wordpress_vapt.description: Missing disclosures and data inventories hinder compliance and incident response.
tests: Check presence and completeness of privacy policy
Map data flows and storage locations

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate data mapping and policy audits

wordpress_vapt.title: Sensitive data exposure in logs and error output
wordpress_vapt.description: Debug logs and verbose errors can leak credentials, tokens, and personal data.
tests: Check WP_DEBUG and display_errors in production
Probe error paths for stack traces

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate log scans and error probes

references.name: OWASP ASVS
references.section: V6 Data Protection—Sensitive Data in Logs

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure handling of analytics/marketing scripts
wordpress_vapt.description: Third-party scripts can exfiltrate data or inject tracking without consent.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate script inventory and CSP audits

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure analytics SDKs
wordpress_vapt.description: Third-party SDKs may exfiltrate data or introduce vulnerabilities.

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed debug endpoints or tools
wordpress_vapt.description: Publicly accessible debug endpoints (e.g., phpinfo, query monitors) leak environment details and secrets.
tests: Check plugin settings for debug exposure
remediation: Restrict debug tools to authenticated admins

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure backup retention and access policies
wordpress_vapt.description: Long retention or broad access to backups increases breach impact and compliance risk.

wordpress_vapt.title: Static secrets in code or assets
wordpress_vapt.description: Hardcoded secrets in PHP/JS/CSS or assets can be extracted and abused.
tests: Scan code and assets for secret patterns
Check build pipelines for secret stripping

wordpress_vapt.title: Reflected XSS in query parameters and search forms
wordpress_vapt.description: Unescaped reflected input allows script execution in victims’ browsers.

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate template scans and reflected XSS probes

wordpress_vapt.title: Unvalidated redirects and phishing vectors
wordpress_vapt.description: Open redirects enable phishing and session hijacking via crafted links.
tests: Probe wp_redirect and custom redirect handlers

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate redirect probes and verify allowlists

references.name: OWASP Top 10
references.section: A01 Broken Access Control (open redirect impact)

wordpress_vapt.title: IDOR on media and private resources
wordpress_vapt.description: Predictable IDs or missing authorization allow access to private media.
tests: Attempt direct access to private media
Check capability checks on download endpoints

wordpress_vapt.title: Nonce leakage via GET or public pages
wordpress_vapt.description: Exposed nonces can be reused to perform CSRF or unauthorized actions.
tests: Check GET usage for state changes

wordpress_vapt.title: Unsanitized post/user meta
wordpress_vapt.description: Untrusted meta fields can lead to stored XSS or logic manipulation.

wordpress_vapt.title: State-changing admin actions via GET
wordpress_vapt.description: Allowing mutations via GET enables CSRF and unintended actions.

wordpress_vapt.title: Misconfigured CORS policies
wordpress_vapt.description: Overly permissive CORS enables cross-domain data leakage.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure API rate limiting
wordpress_vapt.description: Absent or weak rate limiting enables DoS and abuse.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure file permissions
wordpress_vapt.description: World-readable or writable sensitive files (e.g., wp-config.php) enable compromise.
tests: Audit permissions for wp-config.php and key directories

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed .git directories
wordpress_vapt.description: Publicly accessible .git directories leak source code and secrets.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insecure cron jobs and scheduled tasks
wordpress_vapt.description: Rogue or misconfigured cron tasks can execute malicious code or exfiltrate data.
tests: Check for unauthorized or obfuscated callbacks
Verify capability checks for task triggers

automation_prompts.ai_check: Generate cron inventory and callback audits

wordpress_vapt.title: Plugin/theme update integrity not verified
wordpress_vapt.description: Updates from untrusted sources or without integrity checks can introduce malware.

wordpress_vapt.title: Excessive cron frequency
wordpress_vapt.description: Overly frequent cron jobs can cause DoS or resource exhaustion.

wordpress_vapt.title: Insufficient logging and monitoring
wordpress_vapt.description: Lack of actionable logs and alerts delays detection of attacks and persistence.
tests: Review logging coverage for auth, admin actions, file changes

references.name: OWASP Top 10
references.section: A09 Security Logging and Monitoring Failures

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed cron endpoints or triggers
wordpress_vapt.description: Publicly accessible cron triggers allow unauthorized task execution.
assurance: Cron triggers protected by auth and nonces

wordpress_vapt.title: Exposed plugin settings pages to low-privilege roles
wordpress_vapt.description: Misconfigured capabilities allow unauthorized users to change security-sensitive settings.
tests: Attempt access to plugin settings with low roles

wordpress_vapt.title: Missing secure cookie flags
wordpress_vapt.description: Cookies without Secure/HttpOnly/SameSite increase hijacking and CSRF risk.

wordpress_vapt.title: Session fixation (no rotation on privilege change)
wordpress_vapt.description: Failure to rotate session IDs on login or role change enables fixation attacks.

wordpress_vapt.title: Excessive admin session lifetime
wordpress_vapt.description: Long-lived admin sessions increase hijacking risk and persistence.
tests: Check session TTL for admin roles
assurance: Short TTL and idle timeout for admin sessions
